title: From John O'Groats to Land's End; Or, 1372 miles on foot; A book of days and chronicle of adventures by two pedestrians on tour
author: Naylor, John Anderton
snippet: In 1526 the Battle of Linlithgow Bridge was foughtat this spot; it was one of those faction fights between two contendingarmies for predominance which were so prevalent in Scotland at the time,the real object, however, being to rescue King James V from thedomination of the Earl of Angus.

title: From John O'Groats to Land's End; Or, 1372 miles on foot; A book of days and chronicle of adventures by two pedestrians on tour
author: Naylor, John Anderton
snippet: About two miles farther on we passed the romantic village of Polmont,and on through a fine stretch of country until we reached anotherfair-sized village called Linlithgow Bridge.
